snippet: Much in Geneva this week was like the last round of Syria peace talks there two years ago. But something fundamental had changed: There was, on both sides, grim resignation.
abstract: Geneva Journal; Syrian rebels' delegates at United Nations-backed peace talks struggle to retain hope for resolution; suffering has surged since previous talks, Pres Bashar al-Assad has gained Russian backing and United States' increasing focus on defeating Islamic State has diverted support from Syrian opposition.
lead_paragraph: Much in Geneva this week was like the last round of Syria peace talks there two years ago. But something fundamental had changed: There was, on both sides, grim resignation.

headline.print_headline: As Syria Talks Stall, Gloom Engulfs Rebels’ Delegates
headline.main: As Syria Talks Fizzle, ‘War Has No Meaning Anymore’

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
